dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4058 IH: Healthy SNAP Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Brecheen (for himself, Mr. Biggs, Ms. Lee of Florida, Mr. Grothman, Mr. Cloud, and Mr. Gallagher) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to require the Secretary to designate food and food products to be made available under the supplemental nutrition assistance program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Healthy SNAP Act of 2023.

section.header: Food under supplemental nutrition assistance program

subsection.text: Section 3(k)(1) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012(k)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking except alcoholic beverages, tobacco and inserting the following designated by the Secretary under section 4(d), except any alcoholic beverages, tobacco, soft drinks, candy, ice cream, prepared desserts such as cakes, pies, cookies, or similar products; and
by striking clauses and inserting paragraphs.

subsection.text: Section 4 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2013) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall designate by regulation the foods and food products that shall be included in the definition of the term food under section 3(k)(1).
In carrying out paragraph (1), the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.text: take into consideration food and food products that—

clause.text: based on nutrition research, contain nutrients lacking in the diets of people in the United States; and
promote the health of the population served by the supplemental nutrition assistance program, based on relevant nutrition science, public health concerns, and cultural eating patterns; and

subparagraph.text: to the maximum extent practicable, ensure that the fat, sugar, and salt content of the food and food products is appropriate.

paragraph.text: As frequently as determined by the Secretary to be necessary to reflect the most recent scientific knowledge, but not less frequently than once every 5 years, the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.text: conduct a scientific review of the food and food products designated under paragraph (1); and
amend those foods and food products, as necessary, to reflect nutrition science, public health concerns, and cultural eating patterns.

paragraph.text: Prepared meals described in section 3(k) shall have nutritional values consistent with regulations developed by the Secretary under this subsection.

To allow for different cultural eating patterns, State agencies may, with the approval of the Secretary, substitute different food for food designated under paragraph (1) subject to the condition that the different food is nutritionally equivalent to the substituted food.
